The four factors of trying to be pure [a: The factor of trying to be pure in ethics
The factor of trying to be pure in mind
The factor of trying to be pure in view
The factor of trying to be pure in freedom
The factor of trying to be pure in ethic: Restrained in the code of conduct
Seeing danger in the slightest fault
Fulfilling purity of ethics or supporting it in every situation by wisdom
Enthusiasm for that—their effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness
The factor of trying to be pure in mind: A mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures
Enters and remains in the first absorption
Enters and remains in the second absorption
Enters and remains in the third absorption
Enters and remains in the fourth absorption
Fulfilling purity of mind or supporting it in every situation by wisdom
Enthusiasm for that—their effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness
The factor of trying to be pure in view: This is the origin of suffering
This is the cessation of suffering
This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering
Fulfilling purity of view or supporting it in every situation by wisdom
Enthusiasm for that—their effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness
The factor of trying to be pure in freed: A noble disciple who has these factors of trying to be pure in ethics, mind, and view
Detaches their mind from things that arouse greed
Frees their mind from things that it should be freed from
Fulfilling purity of freedom or supporting it in every situation by wisdom
Enthusiasm for that—their effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness
